li.a: Marion ISD March 25 Board Meeting Recording
Marion ISD April 15th Board Meeting Recording

div.p: The mission of the Marion Independent School District, as the primary source for public education is to prepare graduates to be responsible, productive citizens in a diverse and changing world, through partnerships with parents and community, by providing opportunities to achieve excellence and personal growth.

img.alt: Parents: If you have any questions, please feel free to call the Krueger campus.
img.title: It's time for Pre-k and Kinder Pre Registration.

div.p: Please visit the Krueger Primary Campus webpage for more information.
*Free public Wifi is now available on our campuses.*

p.br: If you do not have internet access, you can now get online with free public Wifi for all our students.

div.p: Simply park in any of the district parking lots close to the building and connect to "MarionPublic" Wifi.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: left;

div.div: Our campus and district offices remain closed. However, someone will be available by phone to assist you from 8am until 12 noon Monday through Friday beginning tomorrow, March 26th. If there is no answer, that means they are on the phone with someone else needing assistance. Please leave a message and they will get back to you as quickly as possible.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: center;
p.span: Out of an abundance of caution, Marion ISD and the surrounding districts have decided to extend spring break by one week.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: center;

div.p: Students will not return to class until Monday, March 23rd.

p.span: More information will follow. Thank you.

Given recent media coverage around the coronavirus, I want to assure you that Marion ISD is keeping track of this situation through proven and trustworthy sources including the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). While health officials believe the risk to our school community is low, I want to assure you that MISD is closely monitoring this matter. [...]

img.alt: The US Surgeon General has declared that vaping is now a epidemic among teens. It is illegal for both teens and adults to vape/smoke on school grounds. Marion ISD has zero tolerance for participation in this activity. Students who sell, give, deliver, possess, or use the substance or are in possession of paraphernalia associated with these items will receive consequences such as ISS, OSS, or DAEP placement depending on number of occurrences and persistence with the problem.

p.span: The US Surgeon General has declared that vaping is now a epidemic among teens. It is illegal for both teens and adults to vape/smoke on school grounds. Marion ISD has zero tolerance for participation in this activity. Students who sell, give, deliver, possess, or use the substance or are in possession of paraphernalia associated with these items will receive consequences such as ISS, OSS, or DAEP placement depending on number of occurrences and persistence with the problem.

div.p: Notice of Election Change Due to COVID-19 Pandemic

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Marion ISD Board of Trustees is exercising its authority as declared by Governor Abbott to postpone the May 2, 2020 trustee election until November 3, 2020. The demands for social distancing to slow the spread of the virus prevents MISD from being able to secure polling places, recruit election workers, and provide voters a safe way to exercise their right to vote.

School Hours:
Elementary Campuses (Krueger and Karrer)
7:40 am to 3:00 pm
Secondary Campuses (Middle & High Schools)
8:30 am to 4:00 pm

p.span: In accordance with Title VI-Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX-Education Amendment of 1972, Section 504-Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and Title II of the American with Disabilities Act of 1992, the Marion Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, sex or handicap.

Conforme al Título VI de la Ley de Derechos Civiles de 1964, al Título IX de las Enmiendas de Educación de 1972, a la Sección 504 de la Ley de Rehabilitación de 1973 y al Título II de la Ley sobre Estadounidenses con Discapacidades de 1992, el Marion Independent School District no discrimina por motivos de raza, color, origen nacional, edad, sexo o discapacidad.
